revision.comment: Fix missing apostrophe. Use authorlink properly in citation
revision.text:
{{coord|52.475|0.825|display=title|region:GB_scale:20000}} {{Campaignbox Viking invasions of England|state=collapsed}} The '''Battle of Ringmere ''' was fought in 1010. Norse sagas recorded a '''battle at ''Hringmaraheior'''''; ''[[Old English language|Old English]] Hringmere-hūō'', modern name '''Ringmere Heath'''.<ref name=WHS>{{Cite journal |last=Stevenson |first=W. H. |authorlink= |title=Notes on Old-English Historical Geography |journal=The English Historical Review |volume=11 |issue=42 |pages=301–304 |date=Apr 1896 |url=https://books.google.com/books?id=bnwQAAAAYAAJ&printsec=frontcover#v=onepage&q&f=false |accessdate=20 May 2011 |postscript=<!-- Bot inserted parameter. Either remove it; or change its value to "." for the cite to end in a ".", as necessary. -->{{inconsistent citations}} |doi=10.1093/ehr/xi.xlii.301}}</ref>
'''The sack of [[Thetford, Norfolk|Thetford]]''' occurred in [[1004 in England|1004]]. [[Sigvatr Þórðarson|Sigvat]] records the victory of [[Ethelred the Unready|King Ethelred]], allied with [[Olaf II of Norway|Saint Olaf]],<ref name=Heim>{{cite book |last=Sturlason |first=Snorre |authorlink=Snorri Sturluson |title=Heimskringla or the Lives of the Norse Kings |publisher=Kessinger Publishing |year=2004 |page=225 |url=https://books.google.com/books?id=ZTVjwf2ZPGYC&printsec=frontcover#v=onepage&q&f=false |isbn =0-7661-8693-8 }}; Edited with notes by Erling Monsen</ref> over the Danes under [[Sweyn Forkbeard]] during the latter's [[Sweyn Forkbeard#Ruler of England|campaigns in England]].
The Battle site was located in lands under the control of [[Ulfcytel Snillingr]], thegn of [[East Anglia]], at a site once thought to be near [[Wretham]],<ref name=Heim/> but now thought to be at Rymer in Suffolk.<ref>{{cite journal|last=Briggs|first=Keith|title=The battle-site and place-name Ringmere|journal=[[Notes and Queries]]|date=December 2011|volume=256|issue=4|pages=491–492|url= http://nq.oxfordjournals.org/content/58/4/491.extract|publisher=[[Oxford University Press|OUP]]|accessdate=13 January 2012|doi=10.1093/notesj/gjr151}}</ref> The ''[[Anglo-Saxon Chronicle]]'' reports that Ulfcytel Snillingr and the "councillors in East Anglia" attempted to buy a truce with Swein, but that the Danes broke the truce and marched to [[Thetford, Norfolk|Thetford]] where a part of the East Anglian [[fyrd]] engaged them. The Danes managed to escape.
[[John of Worcester]] records that the Danes defeated the Saxons. Over a three-month period the Danes wasted East Anglia, burning Thetford and [[Cambridge]].<ref name=WHS/>
